title: Senior Test Engineer
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. Your role and your team:
You will report directly to the Manager of the Aerostructure Test Team. The Team is responsible for preparing and conducting mechanical tests on the aircraft structure and components. We collaborate closely with the design team to ensure the most effective test approach for our product.
As a Senior Test Engineer, you will have end-to-end responsibility of a test from its initial request until delivery of the test data, always keeping the goal of qualification and certification of our aircraft in mind. As recognized expert in your field, you will support and advise our design office on the definition and evaluation of test campaigns, as well as guide your team members on their test projects. For tests subcontracted to external laboratories, you will act as the technical focal point and coordinator between our design team and the lab.
For complex test setups, you will be the rig development engineer, including coordination of design and manufacturing suppliers. Moreover, you will guide and implement the development and maintenance of our internal test facility when needed. This includes the preparation of test capabilities based on low-maturity requirements using your testing experience.
 
Your Day to Day:

For each test, you will be responsible of the following activities (whenever applicable):

Assessment of the test request and refinement together with the design team
Preparation of a test concept
Detailed design of the test & measurement setup
Built of the test setup, incl. coordination of manufacturing and purchasing
Planning of the test execution, incl. test procedure and risk assessments
Hands-on execution of the test
Post-processing of the data and results reporting

Develop complex test rigs and setups and coordinate our support teams (Software, CAD, Technicians). This will involve managing key suppliers.
Evaluate test concepts with idealization of physical effects and first-principle reasoning
Create and review engineering documentation for our test setups and results
Advise the design team on the detailed definition of test requirements and plans for certification
Feedback your findings and opinion to the design team for product improvement
Support resource & workload planning and coordination with interfacing teams
Be a role model for a safe work environment in the lab
Constantly learn new things about our test articles and the way we test them – and share them with your team members
Work on any ad-hoc projects or tasks

Your Profile:

University degree in Mechanical Engineering or Aerospace Engineering (M.Sc/M.Eng preferred)
Minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience in aerospace development programs
Ability to find creative solutions to complex problems across engineering disciplines, under time and cost constraints
Good knowledge and experience of measurement technology and data acquisition systems is required (NI or Dewesoft preferred)
Good knowledge and experience of full-scale mechanical test principles (static and fatigue) is required
Good knowledge of composite structures is required
Experience in fixture design & rig development with emphasis on manufacturability is required
Good knowledge and experience in certification processes and procedures is required
Experience with operating hydraulic control systems (MTS preferred) is beneficial
Good knowledge of a CAD system is beneficial (Siemens NX preferred)
Experience in ground vibration tests and/or crash & impact testing is beneficial

Your Personality:

Driven individual with the ability to probe & challenge assumptions
Ability to work with incomplete requirements and to anticipate customer needs
High level of self-reliance with the ability to work in a diverse team
Target-oriented work style with analytic problem-solving skills is required
Ability and willingness to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing work environment
Fluent English language skills are essential, fluent German or any other language is beneficial
Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

questions.description:
Lilium Website Privacy Notice

Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice

** For clarity, to comply with our legal obligations, Lilium will collect, store, and process your data for 6 months for the purpose of considering you for employment.  Additionally, should you provide consent directly below, Lilium will also collect, store, and process your data for up to 730 days thereafter for the purpose of considering you for other opportunities on the Lilium Career Portal.
questions.label: Data Protection Information

values.label: I confirm that I have read and understood the Lilium Website Privacy Notice and the Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice, regarding the collection, processing and storage of my personal data for the recruitment process.

questions.label: IMPORTANT: I confirm I have submitted my CV in English, and understand that my application will not be reviewed if it is in another language
